exercise_suggestions.exercise_suggestion: 1. For your first meal eaten after exercise reduce  mealtime insulin by 50%
2. Check blood glucose regularly after your exercise and before bed

3. Reduce overnight basal insulin by 20% and / or take a bedtime snack without insulin (e.g. fruit and yoghurt/ yoghurt drink) to help reduce nighttime hypoglycaemia following afternoon/ evening exercise

1. Your blood glucose may be high after this high intensity exercise. Try a 20-30mins cool down (light jog & stretching) or take 50% of your normal correction dose post exercise to help reduce blood glucose
2. For your first meal eaten after exercise reduce  mealtime insulin by 50%
3. Check blood glucose regularly after your exercise and before bed

4. Reduce overnight basal insulin by 20% and / or take a bedtime snack without insulin (e.g. fruit and yoghurt/ yoghurt drink) to help reduce nighttime hypoglycaemia following afternoon/ evening exercise
1. Your blood glucose may be high after your exercise. Try a 20-30min cool down (light jog & stretching) or take 50% of your normal correction dose after exercise to help reduce blood sugars
2. For your first meal eaten after exercise reduce  mealtime insulin by 50%
3. Check blood glucose regularly after your exercise and before bed

4. Reduce overnight basal insulin by 20% and / or take a bedtime snack without insulin (e.g. fruit and yoghurt/ yoghurt drink) to help reduce nighttime hypoglycaemia following afternoon/ evening exercise
Anaerobic exercise is done at moderate to high intensity. Change to at least 4-6 on the intensity scale

2. For your first meal eaten after exercise reduce  mealtime insulin by 50%
3. Check blood glucose regularly after your exercise and before bed

4. Reduce overnight basal insulin by 20% and / or take a bedtime snack without insulin (e.g. fruit and yoghurt; yoghurt drink) to help reduce nighttime hypoglycaemia following afternoon/ evening exercise
Anaerobic exercise is done at moderate to high intensity. Change to at least 4-6 on the intensity scale
